cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who played solomon in little house on the prairie
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: To answer the question about who played Solomon in "Little House on the Prairie," I need to recall the characters and actors from the show. "Little House on the Prairie" is a well-known television series based on the books by Laura Ingalls Wilder. The character Solomon is not one of the main characters, so I will need to think about guest appearances or specific episodes where this character might have appeared. 

After considering the series and its episodes, I remember that the character Solomon was portrayed by actor James Cromwell in the episode titled "Dark Sage." This episode deals with themes of racism and medical practices in the 19th century.

Answer: James Cromwell played Solomon in "Little House on the Prairie."

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who played solomon in little house on the prairie
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['The series stars former NFL Los Angeles Rams defensive tackle football player and "Little House on the Prairie" actor Merlin Olsen as an 1870s frontiersman named John Michael Murphy who teams up with prospector Moses Gage (Moses Gunn) to shelter a group of orphans who are being threatened with internment in a workhouse. Murphy disguises himself as a priest and befriends a schoolmarm to help the children find a home.\n', 'BULLET::::- "Little House on the Prairie" (1976-1979) as Dean Russell Harmon / Snell\n', 'Guest stars Devon Odessa, Alyson Croft, and Joshua John Miller all won Young Artist Awards for their appearances. Landon\'s "Bonanza" co-star Lorne Greene appeared in a 1985 episode. Landon\'s "Little House on the Prairie" co-star Matthew Laborteaux appeared in the season one episode "The Right Thing". Moses Gunn, who also co-starred on "Little House" and starred on "Father Murphy", appeared in the season two episode "Popcorn, Peanuts and Cracker Jacks". Barbara Stuart appeared as Carla in the 1986 two-part episode "Love and Marriage". In his last roles, Tyler McVey appeared in separate episodes in 1985 and 1986 as a minister. Don Keefer portrayed Dr. Washburn in the 1986 episode "For the Love of Larry". Anthony Zerbe starred in the episode "The Devil and Jonathan Smith", playing a slave of the Devil whose mission was the exact opposite of Jonathan\'s. In season one\'s two-part episode, "The Thoroughbred", Helen Hunt starred as a young and expectant mother with cancer, as did Richard Bull, who previously co-starred with Landon and French on "Little House on the Prairie". In season three\'s "Code Name: Freak", a young Jeff B. Davis, known for his appearances on "Whose Line is it Anyway?", guest starred as a twelve-year-old child genius. The episode "Wally" guest stars Dick Van Dyke as a hobo with a puppet show who used all his money to help others. The season one episode "One Winged Angel" guest stars Wil Wheaton as Max. In season three a young Paul Walker ("The Fast and the Furious") starred in two episodes.\n', 'Part\'s first acting job was in an episode of "Lucas Tanner" called "Collision" in 1975. Later that year, he was in an episode of "ABC Afterschool Special" and also made a guest appearance on "The Waltons". From 1975 to 1977, Part acted in twenty-one episodes of "Little House on the Prairie" as Carl Sanderson Edwards, the first of which was "Remember Me - Part 1". In the episode, Julia Sanderson (Patricia Neal), a widow with three children (of which Part was the middle), learns that she is going to die and needs to find a home for her children. In the continuation of the episode, Part and his television siblings, Radames Pera and Kyle Richards, are adopted by the recently married Mr. and Mrs. Edwards, played by Victor French and Bonnie Bartlett.\n', 'In 1980, Cromwell guest-starred in the two-part episode "Laura Ingalls Wilder" of the long-running television series "Little House on the Prairie". He played Harve Miller, one of Almanzo Wilder\'s (Dean Butler) old friends.\n']

### Answer:
James Cromwell played Solomon in "Little House on the Prairie."

Murphy disguises himself as a priest and befriends a schoolmarm to help the children find a home.\n', 'BULLET::::- "Little House on the Prairie" (1976-1979) as Dean Russell Harmon / Snell\n', 'Guest stars Devon Odessa, Alyson Croft, and Joshua John Miller all won Young Artist Awards for their appearances. Landon\'s "Bonanza" co-star Lorne Greene appeared in a 1985 episode. Landon\'s "Little House on the Prairie" co-star Matthew Laborteaux appeared in the season one episode "The Right Thing". Moses Gunn, who also co-starred on "Little House" and starred on "Father Murphy", appeared in the season two episode "Popcorn, Peanuts and Cracker Jacks". Barbara Stuart appeared as Carla in the 1986 two-part episode "Love and Marriage". In his last roles, Tyler McVey appeared in separate episodes in 1985 and 1986 as a minister. He played Harve Miller, one of Almanzo Wilder\'s (Dean Butler) old friends.\n']

question_info.question: who played solomon in little house on the prairie
passages:
The series stars former NFL Los Angeles Rams defensive tackle football player and "Little House on the Prairie" actor Merlin Olsen as an 1870s frontiersman named John Michael Murphy who teams up with prospector Moses Gage (Moses Gunn) to shelter a group of orphans who are being threatened with internment in a workhouse. Murphy disguises himself as a priest and befriends a schoolmarm to help the children find a home.
BULLET::::- "Little House on the Prairie" (1976-1979) as Dean Russell Harmon / Snell
Guest stars Devon Odessa, Alyson Croft, and Joshua John Miller all won Young Artist Awards for their appearances. Landon's "Bonanza" co-star Lorne Greene appeared in a 1985 episode. Landon's "Little House on the Prairie" co-star Matthew Laborteaux appeared in the season one episode "The Right Thing". Moses Gunn, who also co-starred on "Little House" and starred on "Father Murphy", appeared in the season two episode "Popcorn, Peanuts and Cracker Jacks". Barbara Stuart appeared as Carla in the 1986 two-part episode "Love and Marriage". In his last roles, Tyler McVey appeared in separate episodes in 1985 and 1986 as a minister. Don Keefer portrayed Dr. Washburn in the 1986 episode "For the Love of Larry". Anthony Zerbe starred in the episode "The Devil and Jonathan Smith", playing a slave of the Devil whose mission was the exact opposite of Jonathan's. In season one's two-part episode, "The Thoroughbred", Helen Hunt starred as a young and expectant mother with cancer, as did Richard Bull, who previously co-starred with Landon and French on "Little House on the Prairie". In season three's "Code Name: Freak", a young Jeff B. Davis, known for his appearances on "Whose Line is it Anyway?", guest starred as a twelve-year-old child genius. The episode "Wally" guest stars Dick Van Dyke as a hobo with a puppet show who used all his money to help others. The season one episode "One Winged Angel" guest stars Wil Wheaton as Max. In season three a young Paul Walker ("The Fast and the Furious") starred in two episodes.
Part's first acting job was in an episode of "Lucas Tanner" called "Collision" in 1975. Later that year, he was in an episode of "ABC Afterschool Special" and also made a guest appearance on "The Waltons". From 1975 to 1977, Part acted in twenty-one episodes of "Little House on the Prairie" as Carl Sanderson Edwards, the first of which was "Remember Me - Part 1". In the episode, Julia Sanderson (Patricia Neal), a widow with three children (of which Part was the middle), learns that she is going to die and needs to find a home for her children. In the continuation of the episode, Part and his television siblings, Radames Pera and Kyle Richards, are adopted by the recently married Mr. and Mrs. Edwards, played by Victor French and Bonnie Bartlett.
In 1980, Cromwell guest-starred in the two-part episode "Laura Ingalls Wilder" of the long-running television series "Little House on the Prairie". He played Harve Miller, one of Almanzo Wilder's (Dean Butler) old friends.
